content:
Diagnosis:
Collision tumor of hepatic flexure - mixed adenocarcinoma and neuroendocrine components

Staging:
CT 15 March 2024 - T3N1M0
PET-CT 20 March 2024 - No distant metastases
Octreotide scan 22 March 2024 - Focal SSTR2 expression in primary tumor

Histology:
Mixed adenocarcinoma (40%) and grade 2 neuroendocrine tumor (60%)
KRAS mutation detected in adenocarcinoma component
SSTR2 positive in NET component
MLH1/MSH2/MSH6/PMS2 - intact

MDT Discussion:
Case presented at Combined Colorectal/NET MDT 25 March 2024
Present: Medical Oncology ([redacted name]), Surgical Oncology ([redacted name]), Pathology ([redacted name]), Radiology ([redacted name])

MDT Recommendations:
1. Primary surgical resection with extended right hemicolectomy
2. Consider adjuvant FOLFOX chemotherapy based on nodal status
3. Consider adjuvant PRRT if significant SSTR2 expression in resected specimen

Plan:
1. Listed for surgery with [redacted name] - date to be confirmed
2. Re-discussion at MDT following surgery for adjuvant therapy decision
3. Follow-up in combined NET/colorectal clinic in 4 weeks

Patient has been informed of diagnosis and management plan. Written information provided regarding surgery and potential adjuvant treatments. [redacted name] understands the complexity of the dual pathology and the need for individualized treatment approach.
